subtasks: Identify and correct a swooping branch by pruning it to a horizontal bud
Remove competing branches to allow dominant branches to receive more light
Shape the central leader by pruning secondary vertical branches and promoting horizontal scaffolds
Adjust tree height by pruning the main leader to a desired height, considering multiple scaffolds
Maintain the modified central leader structure by pruning to avoid two central leaders
Guide tree growth by pruning to a central leader
Space branches evenly around the trunk for optimal light distribution
Remove excessive branches to prevent competition and ensure each branch can fruit freely
Shape the tree's canopy by maintaining a balanced horizontal branching structure
Adjust pruning height for accessibility

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Pruning and Shaping Apple Trees
subtasks: Identify and correct a swooping branch by pruning to a horizontal bud.
Remove competing branches to prevent overgrowth and ensure light distribution.
Shape the central leader by pruning excess branches.
Adjust tree height by cutting back the main leader.
Space branches evenly around the trunk for optimal light and airflow.
Maintain even horizontal branching structure.
Remove excessive or crossing branches to facilitate fruit production.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Pruning apple trees for modified central leader form
subtasks: Correct branches with improper growth direction.
Remove competing branches to promote dominant growth.
Establish a single central leader by pruning secondary branches.
Trim the main leader to desired height for accessibility.
Encourage horizontal branching by selectively pruning vertical growth.
